bug.short_desc: Blog: Blockquotes are not visually highlighted (and potentially a issue regarding lists in comments)

long_desc.thetext:
I just entered a comment (bug's URL) in the WP-based blog and noticed that blockquotes are being accepted but not highlighted in any way. This is tricky and makes the comment interpretation confuse and much harder, because one can't distinguish original text from commenter content.
I guess this was working during previous comments I made (if memory isn't playing tricks with me), so I'm assuming this is was a regression caused by the (recent?) WordPress upgrade (to 2.9.1).
Also, following "I’d say that:" (in the comment I made, bug's URL) I've entered an unnumbered list (using HTML tags) which was transformed back to paragraphs and line breaks. AFAIK these HTML tags are accepted in WordPress comments so I'm not sure if it deserves a separate issue or if this is intended behavior. If it's intended, please confirm it and edit the bug subject. ;-)
Move open issues to RESOLVED – LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
